at.irian.ankor.ref

Interface TypedRef<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CollectionRef, FxRef, MapRef, Ref, RefImplementor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ELRef, RefBase

    public interface TypedRef<T>
    Typed reference to a view model object.

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        void setValue(T value)
        Change the value of the underlying model object.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value

      • getValue

        <X> X getValue()
        Get the value of the underlying model object.
        Returns:
        value of the underlying model field
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if value is not valid

      • isValid

        boolean isValid()
        Returns:
        true, if the value of this Ref can be resolved; false, if resolving the value would cause an IllegalStateException (because the parent Ref no longer exists)

      • root

        Ref root()
        Returns:
        Ref to the root object of the underlying model this Ref belongs to

      • parent

        Ref parent()
        Returns:
        Ref to the model object that is the structural parent of the object referenced by this Ref, null if this Ref is the root

      • appendPath

        Ref appendPath(String propertyOrSubPath)
        Parameters:
        propertyOrSubPath - name of a property or a valid property path (see PathSyntax)
        Returns:
        Ref to the model object this path evaluates to relative to this Ref
        See Also:
        PathSyntax.concat(String, String), $(String)

      • appendIndex

        Ref appendIndex(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - index
        Returns:
        Ref to the indexed element of the model object of type List or an array referenced by this Ref
        See Also:
        PathSyntax.addArrayIdx(String, int), $(int)

      • appendLiteralKey

        Ref appendLiteralKey(String literalKey)
        Parameters:
        literalKey - literal String key
        Returns:
        Ref to the mapped value of the model object of type Map referenced by this Ref
        See Also:
        PathSyntax.addLiteralMapKey(String, String)

      • appendPathKey

        Ref appendPathKey(String pathKey)
        Parameters:
        pathKey - key, which is itself a path that must resolve to a literal String key
        Returns:
        Ref to the mapped value of the model object of type Map referenced by this Ref
        See Also:
        PathSyntax.addPathMapKey(String, String)

      • $

        Ref $(String propertyOrSubPath)
        Shortcut synonym for appendPath(String) and appendLiteralKey(String)

      • $

        Ref $(int index)
        Shortcut synonym for appendIndex(int)

      • path

        String path()
        Returns:
        the full structural path of this Ref
        See Also:
        PathSyntax

      • isDescendantOf

        boolean isDescendantOf(Ref ref)
        Returns:
        true, if the given Ref is a parent (or grandparent, or...) of this Ref

      • isAncestorOf

        boolean isAncestorOf(Ref ref)
        Returns:
        true, if the given Ref is a child (or grandchild, or...) of this Ref

      • propertyName

        String propertyName()
        Returns the "property" this Ref is referencing. Depending on the actual path node type this can be:
        • the name of a bean property (e.g. refFactory.ref("foo.bar").propertyName() returns "bar")
        • an index (e.g. refFactory.ref("foo.bar[5]").propertyName() returns "5")
        • a literal map key (e.g. refFactory.ref("foo['bar']").propertyName() returns "bar")
        Returns:
        the name of the (bean) property this Ref is referencing
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this Ref references a value mapped by a path key (see appendPathKey(String)
        See Also:
        PathSyntax.getPropertyName(String)

      • ancestor

        Ref ancestor(String ancestorPropertyName)

      • isRoot

        boolean isRoot()

      • context

        RefContext context()

      • fire

        void fire(Action action)

      • delete

        void delete()

      • toCollectionRef

        CollectionRef toCollectionRef()

      • toMapRef

        MapRef toMapRef()

      • signalValueChange

        void signalValueChange()

      • isVirtual

        boolean isVirtual()
        Applying a new value to a virtual Ref does not change the underyling property value. It is allowed to set a new value on a read-only virtual Ref (see isReadOnly()). Applying a new value to a virtual Ref causes a ChangeEvent getting fired - like normal Refs.
        Returns:
        true, if this Ref is virtual and there is no real value behind this Ref

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns:
        true, if this Ref is read-only
